pair up.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to become friends and start to have a relationship
pair up.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: We learned later that he and Tanya had paired up.
pair up.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to work together to do something or to put two people together to do something
pair up.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: They first paired up in the screen adaptation of ‘Grease’.
They have paired up writers and artists, and commissioned linked works.
pair up.translation[0].definitions[2].de: if animals pair up, they come together in order to breed
pair up.translation[1].definitions[0].de: if two people or companies pair up, or are paired up, they work together
pair up.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Six months ago the company created a ‘buddy system’ which paired up employees.
To avoid losing his company, Mr. Ross paired up with Chris-Craft Industries Inc.
